Articles.Content: Alright, that explains the problems I have been hadding with mass. Thanks for the help
The things we learn just silently watching the experts play. Ahh one day when I grow up, I shall be a coder too. One day.

## 
Version 1.21 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.1</small>

<small>Released on 2016-04-19</small>

- Fixed Compatibility with KER and MechJeb
Hello, this is not yet been updated for build 1.1.0.1228 correct? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 10 minutes ago, Cratzz said:
> 
> 
> Hello, this is not yet been updated for build 1.1.0.1228 correct? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

Correct, but does it matter?

It shouldn't matter.

Confirmed - V1.21 fixes the Mass issue, but I still can't change fuel types on the Stock Rockomax Jumbo-64.

My super-scientific test (firing a big rocket straight up) still resulted in a slightly higher apoapsis with the Jumbo-64 for unknown reasons, but that might just because I suck at going in a straight line.

In an effort to correct for this, I will add moar powah!  

EDIT: Second test also resulted in 2x64 being *slightly* better at clawing for height than 1x128. Strange considering the resulting ship should be similar.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-19T21:28:51Z" title="04/19/2016 09:28  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 19, 2016</time> by PyroSA**

Thanks for taking care of that.  Very impressive responsiveness!  I'll close the corresponding issue I made on the KER github.

That is a CKAN issue, not sure why you're logging it under IFS.

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, PyroSA said:
> 
> 
> It shouldn't matter.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Confirmed - V1.21 fixes the Mass issue, but I still can't change fuel types on the Stock Rockomax Jumbo-64.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> My super-scientific test (firing a big rocket straight up) still resulted in a slightly higher apoapsis with the Jumbo-64 for unknown reasons, but that might just because I suck at going in a straight line.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> In an effort to correct for this, I will add moar powah!  
>   
> 
> EDIT: Second test also resulted in 2x64 being *slightly* better at clawing for height than 1x128. Strange considering the resulting ship should be similar.
> 

Not sure how this is related to IFS functionality. MOst likely you were using a mod which uses IFS to add fuel switching to all fuel tanks, including the Stock Rockomax Jumbo-64. I would advice to update all your mods to a 1.1 version that is compatible with the latest 1.1 release.

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, PyroSA said:
> 
> 
> That is a CKAN issue, not sure why you're logging it under IFS.
> 

Also IFS 1.19 is outdated and will not work at all with KSP 1.1 That's why I removed it. The question is why isn't the CKAN list updated to the proper 1.21 version?
Am I missing something? Where can I find the new release?

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, rough93 said:
> 
> 
> Am I missing something? Where can I find the new release?
> 

I think you are ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P") links in the first post. Ckan also has latest version.
Indeed, though the link for the 1.1 version is to curse.com rather than curseforge.com so people will have to suffer the somewhat ad-heavy, main curse site rather than one with no ads...

> 
> 
> On 20/04/2016 at 10:15 AM, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> Not sure how this is related to IFS functionality. Most likely you were using a mod which uses IFS to add fuel switching to all fuel tanks, including the Stock Rockomax Jumbo-64. I would advice to update all your mods to a 1.1 version that is compatible with the latest 1.1 release.
> 

I must've been confusing it with another mod I had previously, thanks.
Alright, for anyone experiencing Antigravity effects with infinite Inertia, it is caused by IFS which is generating negative mass. I will upload a fix shortly

> 
> 
> 3 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> Alright, for anyone experiencing Antigravity effects with infinite Inertia, it is caused by IFS which is generating negative mass. I will upload a fix shortly
> 

Oh that may explain some oddness I've been seeing. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

## 
Version 1.22 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.1</small>

<small>Released on 2016-04-22</small>

- Fixed Issue where IFS was generating negative mass, which could result in Anti-gravity/Floating effect and infinite Inertia
still floating :/

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, gary85 said:
> 
> 
> still floating :/
> 

Edit: confimed

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-23T18:05:08Z" title="04/23/2016 06:05  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 23, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

## 
Version 1.23 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.1</small>

<small>Released on 2016-04-23</small>

- Fixed incorrect mass issue with dry mass getting higher than intended or lower which could result in floating

## 
Version 1.24 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.1</small>

<small>Released on 2016-04-24</small>

- Fixed mass of rescaled tanks while in the VAB , allowing tools like KER and Mechjeb to calculate Delata V more accurately
- Will now correctly display Dry-mass, Wet-Mass and Total Mass in the VAB and in flight

> 
> 
> 37 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> ## 
> Version 1.24 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.1</small>
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <small>Released on 2016-04-24</small>
> 
> 
> 
> - Fixed mass of rescaled tanks while in the VAB , allowing tools like KER and Mechjeb to calculate Delata V more accurately
> - Will now correctly display Dry-mass, Wet-Mass and Total Mass in the VAB and in flight
> 

Ahh thanks... was just about to document the issue....
